repository.corpname: University of Denver Libraries, Special Collections and Archives

odd.head: General
odd.p: There is no accession record for these materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 1 of 8 is a compilation of materials that cover Lillian Covillo's early work with the Denver Grand Opera Company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 2 is arranged chronologically. __Lillian Covillo's work with the Martha Wilcox Dance Group is separated from her dance studios work. Oversized items are in oversized photo box

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Lillian Covillo's work with the Martha Wilcox Dance Group is separated from her dance studios work. Oversized items are in oversized photo box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 2 of 8 documents Lillian Covillo's work as dancer, teacher, and studio owner before the Colorado Ballet. It includes photos and programs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 3 is arranged as close to chronologically as possible. __Oversized items are in oversized photo box

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Oversized items are in oversized photo box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 3 of 8 covers material related to Freidann Parker outside of her work with Lillian Covillo. It includes photos and one program.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 4 items are arranged by performance and student as best as possible __Oversized items are in oversized photo box.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Oversized items are in oversized photo box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 4 of 8 covers photos of students from Lillian Covillo's various schools of dance.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 5 is arranged chronologically __Oversized items are in oversized photo box

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Oversized items are in oversized photo box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 5 of 8 covers programs, pamphlets, and clippings that relate to Lillian Covillo as a child, a much older adult, and a ballet enthusiast around the world. It includes her funeral program and programs from other ballet companies she may have enjoyed.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 6 items, for the most part, lack dates so like items are grouped in folders and folders are arranged arbitrarily.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 6 of 8 contains newspaper clippings about the Lillian Covillo's personal life, her dance work, her student's lives, and those of her friends.

did.unittitle: Colorado Concert Ballet and Colorado Ballet

physdesc.extent: This series contains one file folder and one spiral bound scrapbook. It shares a flat box with Series 8 items

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 7 items were organized in scrapbook before they became part of the collection. All other items are in a second folder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 7 of 8 contains a late 60's scrapbook of company rehearsal and performance and newspaper clippings related to the company.

physdesc.extent: This is one scrpbook that shares a flat box with Series 7 items

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 8 was arranged before it became part of the collection but is mostly chonological.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 8 of 8 is a scrapbook compiled by Lillian Covillo's mother, Mrs. John Covillo. It covers Lillian Covillo's early dance work with photos, programs, notes, and newspaper clippings.

did.abstract: Contains souvenir and house programs, newspaper clippings, and photographs of Lillian Covillo's activities in the Denver ballet community prior to the founding of Colorado Ballet. This includes: Covillo-Parker School of Dance, Lillian Covillo Balllet Company, Covillo-Parker Theatre Ballet Company and related companies and performances. A scrapbook with snapshots of a Colorado Concert Ballet performance of ''Romeo and Juliet,'' choreographed by Freidann Parker, and the classes and studios at the East Colfax and Fairax studio is also included.
